title: The Temple of Moloch
data:
**The Temple of Moloch** is a special level in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). In dNetHack, the Temple of Moloch is accessed by a second down stair that is located between levels 5 and 25; in all other variants, the stair is located between levels 32 and 35.

As the name implies, the main section of the level is a "temple" dedicated to [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch") (though it is not considered an (un)aligned temple), with the altar surrounded by four [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") of Moloch.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 The level](#The_level)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [2.1 The altar](#The_altar)
  - [2.2 The candles](#The_candles)

- [3 See also](#See_also)

## The level

             ----- ----- ----- ----- -----

There are two spiked pits in the stair room. The X mark indicates a burned message reading "Those Not of Moloch, Begone!"

The niches on the sides of the temple each contain a statue gargoyle, and the main area contains a bone devil, a [babau](/wiki/Babau "Babau"), a barbed devil, a vrock, a horned devil, a hezrou, and 21 random Z; notably, this can include [ghoul queens](/wiki/Ghoul_queen "Ghoul queen"), which are not randomly generated otherwise and considered extremely dangerous.

The room on the far right contains nine piles of treasure, each composed of a chest, a stack of wax candles, a random amount of gold, and three random objects. In dNetHack, the center chest also contains a [scroll of consecration](/wiki/Scroll_of_consecration "Scroll of consecration").

## Strategy

Before walking further into the temple, use [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") or [monster detection](/wiki/Monster_detection "Monster detection") to check for any ghoul queens: they possess dual spellcasting attacks, can [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties"), move at the same base speed as [you](/wiki/You "You"), and are not [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") - this means will happily sit outside of the ring of monsters they have summoned, continually summoning more. In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), ghoul queens should be your highest-priority targets, equal to or even above the hostile priests; [ghoul mages](/wiki/Ghoul_mage "Ghoul mage") should be dealt with quickly as well if they cannot be avoided, since their [aggravate](/wiki/Aggravate "Aggravate") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") can result in your retreat being quickly cut off.

Be cautious when attacking the priests of Moloch, as Moloch responds with divine lightning bolts, blinding you even if you have reflection/lightning resistance. They also hit fairly hard in melee and ignore [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), and the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") spell can create far stronger insects, with specific monsters depending on the variant.

### The altar

The altar to Moloch can be converted, and is one of two guaranteed altars in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, with the other occurring in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest"). This may prove useful in games where very few altars generate otherwise, as the [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") priest is the only guaranteed source of [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") since the priest in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") is generated hostile in those variants. Conversely, the altar here can also be used to make [unholy water](/wiki/Unholy_water "Unholy water").

### The candles

The "back room" is guaranteed to contain at least nine wax candles (usually many more), more than enough to complete the [Invocation](/wiki/Invocation "Invocation") ritual. This is useful in games where [Izchak](/wiki/Izchak "Izchak")'s shop does not generate enough candles, or even simply for absentminded players who forgot to collect candles early on.

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")
